source.author: Conran, J.G.
source.title: Liliaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: Modified from: Conran, J.G. (1994). Liliaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Leaves green, more or less glossy, usually rather thin-textured and tending toward flaccid, to 14(–20) mm wide at midpoint when flattened; mostly plants of open forests
Leaves glaucous, dull, rather thick-textured and firm; leaves 12–25 mm wide at midpoint when flattened; commonly plants of grasslands and grassy woodlands
